elements.title: resplendent quetzal (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that killing a resplendent quetzal (pictured) was a crime in Aztec and Maya law?

elements.title: transgender asylum seekers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that, among migrants, transgender asylum seekers are more likely to be subjected to physical and mental abuse?

elements.title: Darb El Arba'īn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that camel caravans using the Darb El Arba'īn trade route transported salt and slaves?

elements.title: upper houses (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Yemen currently has two parliamentary upper houses?

elements.title: Haw Par Villa MRT station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the public artwork Eroclamation at Haw Par Villa MRT station reflects Haw Par Villa's themes of mortality and reincarnation?

elements.title: Japanese language schools (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Australia has three major Japanese language schools?

elements.title: Who shall separate us? (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in "Who shall separate us?", composed by James MacMillan for the state funeral of Elizabeth II, verses from Romans 8 are followed by Alleluias described as "burning bright sonic trails"?

elements.title: Cloghan Castle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the collapse of Cloghan Castle in County Cork, Ireland, was said to have been caused by the barking of a ghostly black dog?
